div.class: custom_19929 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
custom_143831 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

font.b: INFORMATION REGARDING COVID-19 AND DISTANCE LEARNING

div.class: custom_143185 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
div.p:
Morgan ISD Parents,
Good afternoon, this is John Bryant, Superintendent of Morgan ISD. I have a few updated announcements that I need to make this evening.
First, given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Governor Greg Abbott has issued an order that all school districts in the state of Texas must remain closed to students and on campus learning until Monday, May 4, 2020. All school instruction must continue to be distance learning.
In an effort to ensure all of our MISD families are able to continue to access the meals (breakfast & lunch) provided by the district, we will continue delivering and handing out meals three days a week (Monday, Wednesday and Friday) through this closure period. Please take advantage of these meals. All children in Morgan ISD [ages 1-18] can receive these meals.
Lastly, campus administration have met and made the decision to cancel all after school activities through the end of the school year. This is includes the 2020 Junior/Senior Prom.

This pandemic has presented unusual circumstances, but we will get through this together!
Thank you for your support and please direct questions you may have to myself or our campus principal.

div.class: custom_144904 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
custom_145990 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: By staying apart for the time being, DISTRICT is working to ensure that we are limiting the spread of COVID-19 in our community. In service of this, I want to share a one-minute video that reminds us of the most important actions we can take as individuals to reduce risk for ourselves and others:
Stay home as much as you can, especially if you have a cough, fever, or shortness of breath
I encourage you to watch this video below with your family. And be sure to share it with family and friends on social media and via email.
Even though we are currently apart, we look forward to coming back together as a community soon.

p.span: Click here for important COVID19 Data and Information for Texas
COVID 19 Campaign Letter from Mr. Bryant – Click here

div.class: custom_142126 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: Due to health concerns and precautions, ALL UIL and Extracurricular activities have been cancelled.

div.p: Morgan ISD is now accepting K-12 transfers. Please contact our front office for more details at 254-635-2311 and/or see our transfer form on the Forms and Documents page under Parents and Community.

div.class: custom_20451 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn
custom_35529 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

div.style: background-color: transparent; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font: 400 13.33px/19.99px Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; overflow: visible; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; text-align: center;
div.p: I am writing today to tell each of you thank you for the work you are doing to help us in this difficult time of trying to help teach your students. You all have played an active role in the education of your students when we were in our normal traditional setting, but now we are asking for so much more of you. You play such a larger role in everything we do now. We need your help making sure your students are getting to class in time. This was the teachers’ job when they were roaming the halls. Teachers would stand outside of class and tell kids to get to their next class. I can still hear Mr. Gosdin, “Where are you suppose to be? This isn’t your class. Go to your class.” LOL! Man how I miss that. Parents, you are now my hall monitors. I need you to get these kids into their classes so we can teach.

Parents, you will also need to be our teachers. Yes the teachers will be building the assignments, but we will need you checking over their shoulders to make sure they stay on task. Monitor how they are working. If they look to be struggling please ask them questions about what they are struggling with and then let us know. We want to help the best we can. Also, make sure they stay awake in class. If they don’t stay awake and refuse to work, well now we ask that you become the next person on the list.

Parents, you will need to be the principal. Here you will need to find ways to motivate your students to learn and want to learn. You will need to listen to their concerns and try and understand why they feel they are struggling. Now you need to be more of a listener. You will need to help them come to the answer on their own and help them see they have the processing skills to be productive. And if all else fails, well, time to move on that next phase of consequences. Sorry kids, I have no say here. LOL!

Finally parents, you will need to take time to take care of yourselves. Take time to breathe through this process and try and find ways to relax. You are not expected to know all the answers, nor are you expected to do this alone. We are a team. More now than ever, we have to be the best team possible. Understand our roles and work together. I am thankful that I have had the pleasure to have each of your students in our school. I miss seeing each of them in the halls and joking with them.
Please keep working hard and trust in what we are doing as a school and community. When this is all said and done with Morgan ISD will be better equipped for the 21st century learner. Thank you.

div.br:
1306 Charles St.
PO Box 300
Morgan, Texas 76671
